scenarioDescription:
The TOI-1518 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-1518 is a star with 1.79 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.95 times its radius. It is located 736.75 light years away from the solar system.

TOI-1518 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-1518 system


TOI-1518 b

TOI-1518 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2021-08, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-1518 b is 731.400 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-1518 b is 21.017 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TOI-1518 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system TOI-1518, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: TOI-1518 - System With 1 Exoplanet
